instructions: Factorise each expression completely. Select the correct answer from the options provided. Remember to always check for common factors first.

questions.question: Factorise: 3x + 6
questions.explanation: HCF of 3x and 6 is 3. Therefore 3x + 6 = 3(x + 2).

questions.question: Factorise: 5x² + 10x
questions.explanation: HCF of 5x² and 10x is 5x. Therefore 5x² + 10x = 5x(x + 2).

questions.question: Factorise: 4x² - 8x
questions.explanation: HCF of 4x² and 8x is 4x. Therefore 4x² - 8x = 4x(x - 2).

questions.question: Factorise: 6x² + 9x
questions.explanation: HCF of 6x² and 9x is 3x. Therefore 6x² + 9x = 3x(2x + 3).

questions.question: Factorise: x² + 5x + 6
questions.explanation: Find two numbers that multiply to 6 and add to 5: 2 and 3. Therefore x² + 5x + 6 = (x + 2)(x + 3).

questions.question: Factorise: x² + 7x + 12
questions.explanation: Find two numbers that multiply to 12 and add to 7: 3 and 4. Therefore x² + 7x + 12 = (x + 3)(x + 4).

questions.question: Factorise: x² + 8x + 15
questions.explanation: Find two numbers that multiply to 15 and add to 8: 3 and 5. Therefore x² + 8x + 15 = (x + 3)(x + 5).

questions.question: Factorise: x² - 5x + 6
questions.explanation: Find two numbers that multiply to 6 and add to -5: -2 and -3. Therefore x² - 5x + 6 = (x - 2)(x - 3).

questions.question: Factorise: x² - 7x + 10
questions.explanation: Find two numbers that multiply to 10 and add to -7: -2 and -5. Therefore x² - 7x + 10 = (x - 2)(x - 5).

questions.question: Factorise: x² - 9x + 18
questions.explanation: Find two numbers that multiply to 18 and add to -9: -3 and -6. Therefore x² - 9x + 18 = (x - 3)(x - 6).

questions.question: Factorise: x² + 2x - 8
questions.explanation: Find two numbers that multiply to -8 and add to 2: 4 and -2. Therefore x² + 2x - 8 = (x + 4)(x - 2).

questions.question: Factorise: x² - 3x - 10
questions.explanation: Find two numbers that multiply to -10 and add to -3: -5 and 2. Therefore x² - 3x - 10 = (x - 5)(x + 2).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: x² + 4x - 3x - 12
questions.explanation: Group: x(x + 4) - 3(x + 4) = (x + 4)(x - 3). Note: Factor out -3 from the second group to match (x + 4).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: x² + 6x - 2x - 12
questions.explanation: Group: x(x + 6) - 2(x + 6) = (x + 6)(x - 2). Note: Factor out -2 from the second group to get -2(x + 6).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: 2x² + 6x - 5x - 15
questions.explanation: Group: 2x(x + 3) - 5(x + 3) = (x + 3)(2x - 5). Note: Factor out -5 from the second group to match (x + 3).

questions.question: Factorise by grouping: 3x² + 9x - 4x - 12
questions.explanation: Group: 3x(x + 3) - 4(x + 3) = (x + 3)(3x - 4). Note: Factor out -4 from the second group to get -4(x + 3).

questions.question: Factorise completely: 2x² + 10x + 12
questions.explanation: First extract common factor: 2(x² + 5x + 6). Then factorise the trinomial: 2(x + 2)(x + 3).

questions.question: Factorise completely: 3x² + 12x + 9
questions.explanation: First extract common factor: 3(x² + 4x + 3). Then factorise the trinomial: 3(x + 1)(x + 3).
